compantIntroDetail.message: AVIC International Holding Corporation (AVIC INTL) upholds the mission of "Go beyond Commerce for a Better World", takes advantage of global network and platform, and actively participates in building "the Belt and Road Initiative".   AVIC INTL owns 6 domestic and overseas listed companies, and has established overseas Branches in 60 countries and regions, with clients throughout over more than 100 countries and regions, and overseas employees exceeding 4,500.

internationalBusiness.message: The business of AVIC INTL involves four segments:

projectResultDetail.message: Since 2009, after realizing the importance of technical and vocational education and training (TVET) to the development of a country, AVIC INTL has started planning and implementing TVET projects through the first TVET project in Kenya. With our unremitting efforts, AVIC INTL provides customized total solutions for TVET, including top-level design, infrastructure construction, training and services, operation management support, smart education, etc., in accordance with the client needs and the TVET development situations in different countries or regions along and surrounding “the Belt and Road”, so as to increase the educated population, improve the labor skills and raise the employment rate in local, for a more stable society, more government revenue and a better government reputation. At present, AVIC INTL has established “AVIC-INTL Vocational Training Center” and “AVIC International TVET Research Institute”. Based on our overseas TVET ecosystem with abundant resources, AVIC INTL builds a bridge for people-to-people bond, and contributes Chinese wisdom and solutions for countries along “the Belt and Road”.

achievement.message: So far, we have made the following achievements:

academy.message: Upgraded and rehabilitated 177 vocational Institutes: 154 in Kenya and 23 in Ghana.

buildAcademy.message: Newly built 12 vocational institutes: 3 in Gabon, 7 in Cote d’Ivoire and 2 in Uganda.

training.message: Capable of training over 20,000 teachers and students every year in our completed projects.

employmentRate.message: The employment rate of students or trainees with high-level skills is over 80%.

signingCountry.message: Have signed contracts with: Kenya, Ghana, Gabon, Uganda, Cote d’Ivoire and Zambia

cooCountry.message: Have reached cooperation intentions with: Egypt, Benin, Togo, Tanzania, Ethiopia, Zimbabwe, The Democratic Republic of the Congo, the Republic of Congo, Senegal, Namibia, Burkina Faso, South Africa, Guinea, Niger, Fiji, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Myanmar, Laos, Uzbekistan, Costa Rica and Kazakhstan.

solvePlanDetail.message: Total Solution -Provide modular solutions mainly for improvement of the national TVET capabilities

teachAbility.message: Improvement of teaching and teaching research capabilities

professional.message: On disciplines options, we could provide solutions for over 40 disciplines in the following 15 professional fields

agriculture.message: Agriculture, forestry, animal husbandry and fishery

socialFirst.message: Africa Tech Chanllenge has been held for 6 years from 2014 to 2019, with 8 participating countries including Cabon, Cote d’lvoire, Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Zambia, Tanzania and Ethiopia. In cooperation with ministries of education as well as the World Bank,  ATC has become a benchmark for international vocational competition.

socialSecond.message: Based on the philosophy that “It is better to teach a man how to fish rather than simply giving him the fish and feeding him”, ATC is focused on improving the youth’s technical skills through training and competition, taking into consideration that the employment rate of the youth in Africa is not satisfactory due to the lack of technical and practical skills. This therefore serves the mission of connecting the vocational education and industrial value chains, and eventually forming a new model for Chinese enterprises to manage their overseas CSR projects.

socialThird.message: The ATC competition adopts the training + competition (preliminary competition + final competition) mode and aims to improve skills of the students participating in the competition so that they can employ what they have learnt. Apart from the training and competition as mentioned above, ATC also successfully organized ATC TALKS, inviting local officials, entrepreneurs and youth leaders to meet the contestants, in order to encourage and inspire the youth to continue chasing their dreams and never giving up.

ecologicalDetail.message: Our company has over 30 college/association partners in the TVET field as well as more than 20 experts as our professional resources, providing strong professional support for our TVET projects.
